Great update from @EnvAgencySW @DCfieldteamsEA on site at Staplake today. Works coming on to enable improved instrumentation kiosk to go in. 

Thanks to all involved including @phil_pullen and @JamesLockyerLTD . This will enable us to keep tabs on #waterresources locally https://t.co/rqztOIsCek

@safepointapp @The_WMA @NorfolkNNSI @EnvAgencyAnglia @BroadsAuth Essentially it smoothers the water - leads to loss of oxygen and loss of habitat. Think the effect is a bit like large algal blooms - but may be totally wrong.

@safepointapp @The_WMA @NorfolkNNSI @EnvAgencyAnglia @BroadsAuth My recollection - it grows blooming fast - think something like 10cm a day in high season (faster than bamboo perhaps?) - and it floats on the surface preventing sunlight getting to plants on the bottom (macrophages?) that are important habitats for all kinds of insects and fish.
